conclusion: Consider the geometry and behavior of light in the semi-cylindrical body.
The semi-cylindrical body has a radius R and length L.
The refractive index n of the material is 2.
Light exits the curved surface if incident at an angle greater than the critical angle.
Using Snell's law, the critical angle θc is calculated as 30°.
The total curved surface area of a full cylinder is 2πRL.
The curved surface area of the semi-cylinder is πRL.
Light exits through the curved surface where the angle of incidence is greater than 30°.
The fraction of the surface where light exits is 5/6.
The area S is calculated as 5/6 × πRL.
The area S of the part of the cylindrical surface through which light exits is 5/6 πRL.
